channel.title: Port-forward
channel.description: hi guys i got a problem about port-forwarding it says that my port isn't open on pfportchecker can someone help me, i will give that person co-owner in-game. if you want to know more add me on skype , haaxxpro

item.title: Port-forward
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

What type of router are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Port-forward
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Fearscapeofficial, post:5, topic:535432”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=654241.msg4382641#msg4382641 date=1384101913]

thank you for the tip, and i no i can’t since the source is blocking the tcp

Just a heads up, the source doesn’t block tcp. It casts on port 43594. Meaning uses, not blocks. Something else, however, could be blocking a port.
Turn the server on and go to http://canyouseeme.org and see if it comes up as online, if not, you did something wrong (or missed a step) and need to fix your port forward.
[/quote]
Can you show me on teamviewer?[/quote]
what would I be showing you? You just need to check the status on a website…

Read full topic

item.title: Port-forward
item.dc:creator: @Fearscapeofficial Fearscapeofficial
item.description:
@Fearscapeofficial wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:535432”][quote author=Fearscapeofficial link=topic=654241.msg4382620#msg4382620 date=1384098950]
thank you for the tip, and i no i can’t since the source is blocking the tcp
[/quote]
Just a heads up, the source doesn’t block tcp. It casts on port 43594. Meaning uses, not blocks. Something else, however, could be blocking a port.
Turn the server on and go to http://canyouseeme.org and see if it comes up as online, if not, you did something wrong (or missed a step) and need to fix your port forward.[/quote]
Can you show me on teamviewer?

Read full topic

item.title: Port-forward
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Fearscapeofficial:

thank you for the tip, and i no i can’t since the source is blocking the tcp

Just a heads up, the source doesn’t block tcp. It casts on port 43594. Meaning uses, not blocks. Something else, however, could be blocking a port.
Turn the server on and go to http://canyouseeme.org and see if it comes up as online, if not, you did something wrong (or missed a step) and need to fix your port forward.

Read full topic

item.title: Port-forward
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

I don’t suggest you to give someone Co-owner for just portforwarding, Since it’s easy thing to do, However Did you run your source while you checking if your port is online?

Read full topic
